lst.name: sentence
lst.str: GM Vice President and chief labor negotiator Alfred Warren recently told Reuters that the 1987 bargaining round would likely be the most difficult of the decade because of the carmaker's drive to cut costs and shed uncompetitive parts-making operations employing thousands of workers.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: United Automobile Workers (UAW) president Owen Bieber was loudly cheered by some 3,000 local delegates at a special bargaining strategy convention yesterday when he declared the 1.1 mln-member union is ready to go to "war" against the major auto makers in support of its goals.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: At Ford, which has more than 8 billion dlrs in cash reserves and out-earned larger GM last year for the first time since 1924, executives said they would oppose the UAW's demand for a return to guaranteed percentage annual pay increases that were dropped in the last recession.
